taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section arguti;species insulanus;

treatment.description: Diffusely branched, up to 1 m. high, with intricately tangled -pendulous branches and branchlets; canes with numerous straight prickles; primocane-leaves rather short-petioled, glabrous and sublustrous above, thin-pilose and glabrescent beneath, with the ribs prominent; terminal leaflet round-ovate or -obovate, abruptly short-acuminate, 7-8 cm. long and 5 or 6 cm. broad, subcordate; corymbs few-flowered; bracteal leaves or leaflets mostly obtuse, elliptic-oblong to oblong-obovate; ascending pedicels short; calyx-lobes soon reflexed; fruit subglobose, about 1 cm. in diameter.
